column1: LESSON 5: DATA ANALYSIS - Become a Data Detective
Sorting Filtering and Pivot Tables oh my!
(Aryan this is where Excel gets actually useful)
1. Select your data (Ctrl+A or click any cell in data)
4. Choose A to Z or Z to A (or smallest to largest)
- Sort by Amount (highest to lowest) - Find the big spenders!
- Sort by Date (oldest to newest) - Timeline view!
- Sort by Customer then Amount - Multi-level sorting!
PART B: FILTERING DATA (Finding the needle in haystack)
2. Go to Data tab > Filter (or Ctrl+Shift+L)
3. Click the dropdown arrows in headers
4. Select what you want to see
1. Show only Aryan's orders (she shops a lot!)
3. Show Pending orders (what's taking so long?!)
PART C: CONDITIONAL FORMATTING (Making data pretty)
3. Use Data Bars for Amount column (visual comparison)
PART D: COUNTIF & SUMIF (Smart counting & adding)
PART D2: COUNTIFS & SUMIFS (Multiple Criteria - Level Up!)
When one condition isn't enough - use the S versions!
Note: SUMIFS puts the sum range FIRST (different from SUMIF!)
PART E: PIVOT TABLES (The Ultimate Boss Move)
- Values: Count of Order_ID & Sum of Amount
(Fill these using the formulas you learned!)
1. Who is the biggest spender? (Sort or SUMIF)
2. Which city has most orders? (COUNTIF or Pivot)
3. What's the average pending order value? (AVERAGEIF)
4. How much did Aryan spend on Delivered items only? (SUMIFS!)
5. How many orders over 2000 are still Pending? (COUNTIFS!)
Congratulations Aryan - you're now a Data Analyst!
